review_blob: Cask, pours bright a bright golden colour witha good hop aroma. Initial citrus flavours are followed by a good dry middle and satisfying hop smack to finsh. Nice and refreshing!!

A beautiful bright amber appearance with a lovely fruity nose. An initial red berry fruit flavour is followed by a butterscotch middle and a superb long caramel malt finish balanced out with a nice hop background. A great traditiional british ale with a great appearance and branding. Lets get some younger people drinking cask ales!!

Dark golden in appearance, little head, fast disappearing with no lace. Sweetish hoppy aroma followed by water mellon. Initially quite malty followed by a subtle fizzyness on the front of the tongue. Highly carbonated and slightly bitter in the finish with little on the palate. Caramel notes a bit warmer. Ok, had much better.

Ascorbic acid?!?! Id rather it were pasteurised. Deep clear yellow colour, pours with little head, fast dissapearing and no lace. Not much of an aroma, mostly cleaning products and oranges. Flavour was average at best, quite malty, no hops to speak of, hint of oranges and mellons with a tangy bitter/sour aftertaste leaving a lingering metallic tasting film on the palate. Urgh! Best frozen, got worse as I kept on drinking but it was a real effort!!
Another beer I love from The Hirter Brewery. A nice aroma and rather hoppy flavour followed by a mild sweetness. A lovely full bodied beer.
Rather malty aroma with a  sliight initial hopiness followed by a deep roasted and caramelised sweet and malty palate. Similar to the 1270
A quite impressive thirst quencher. Light and obviously heavily carbonated. The natural sweetness of the beer compliments the bitterness of the lemons rather well.
A pale golden unfiltered lager. A complex beer with many aromas and flavours. Exceptionally hoppy and yeasty quickly followed by a light sweetness. This is my kind of brewery!
Made with organic wheat and hops. Smells fruity and fresh with mild pangs of banana. Leaving a longlasting pleasant taste on the palate. A good Weizen.
Rather malty aroma with a descrete hoppines. Initially presents quite dry with a medium sweetness and a genlte bitterness left on the palate.
Another fine beer from Hirter. Pale and golden appearance, hoppy aroma with an initial sweet hoppiness followed by a gentle bitter aftertaste. Similar to the privat pils just less complex
A pale appearance with slight malty aromas. Slightly sweet, dry and citrusy. Quite thin and light but very pleasant for an organic beer.

The first beer to be brewed by this historic brewery when it set up as a service station refreshing Knights and Merchants passing along the ancient Venice - Vienna trade route. Only available on draught, this reminds me of a full-bodied early evolution of Drehers Viennese brew. Sweet and hoppy with deep roasted and caramelised malty undertones. Heaven

A fine example of a Bohmian Pilsner. An initial sweetness is followered by a delicarte harmonious bitterness on the palate. When drunk at its ideal drinking temperature of 8oc, the flavour is full of sweetness and many hoppy aromas come to the fore. Very soft and full bodied too (down to the alpine spring water). I can even drink it warm!
